title: How can one become a millionaire by working for Google? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well the average compensation in Google is significant. So you don’t need to be the CEO to earn a lot of money. Many people in middle positions, or a little higher than middle, even 150–200k or above, according to Glassdoor and other websites;  In which case, it is fairly easy. Just live below your means, and invest the surplus well. If you get to management level? Even easier. The key? Avoid keeping up with the Jones’ and letting stress kill your budget. Many people in corporate careers `live for the weekend` and overspend due to stress or hating their job. I know several people in the big tech firms who don’t save or invest anything, for this reason. 52 finance tipsWhy the wealthy spend less on luxury: the 70/30 rule in finance

By judiciously saving your salary. I was a millionaire before I even started at Google (or even Intel which was 15 years before that). I was simply a software engineer that saved and invested most of my (and my ex-wife’s income). This “secret” has been known a long time and books with titles like The Millionaire Next Door outline the basic strategy. Note that whether you will be happy or not following that strategy is the more important question. Most people who want to be a millionaire, don’t actually want that as their goal, but instead to live a lavish life-style. Very different goal.
